original: a. “Contract Period ” shall mean that period of time from February 21, 2011 through December 31, 2012.
modified: b. "Contract Term" shall refer to the duration commencing on February 21, 2011 and continuing until any termination occurs prior to December 31, 2012, provided that such termination does not occur unless expressly permitted by this agreement or required by law.

original: b. “Contract Year ” shall mean the specific period of time during the Contract Period as more specifically set forth below:
modified:
c. "Contract Year" shall refer to any distinct segment within the Contract Period, as explicitly defined below:

In this revised version, I've shifted the focus from a specific period of time to any distinct segment within the Contract Period. This allows for greater flexibility and potentially multiple periods during the Contract Period could be considered "Contract Years."

original: 3. Grant of License and Exclusivity.  Subject to the terms set forth in this Agreement, North hereby grants to Company the right and privilege to use North ’s Likeness and North ’s Endorsement during the Term and within the Contract Territory in all reasonable forms of advertising including, but not limited to television (including the infomercial format), radio, print advertising, brochures, pamphlets, product packaging, point -of-purchase materials, Company ’s web -site and a demonstration video (hereinafter referred to as “Advertising Materials ”) in connection with Company ’s advertisement and sale of the Endorsed Product only. During the Term of this Agreement and within the Contract Territory, North agrees not to enter into an agreement with another company or entity for the purpose of endorsing or promoting products similar to the Endorsed Products. Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, Company shall be prohibited from using or distributing any new or existing Advertising Materials using North ’s Likeness and North ’s Endorsement except for Endorsed Product with North’s Likeness and/or North ’s Endorsement on the packaging that is already in the channel of retail distribution. Company shall be prohibited from selling or shipping any new Endorsed Product with North ’s Likeness and/or North ’s Endorsement on the packaging upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 3. License Grant and Exclusivity. Upon the conditions specified in this Agreement, Company is granted by North the authorization to utilize North's Likeness and North's Endorsement throughout the Term and within the Contracted Region, across various forms of advertising such as television, radio, print media, brochures, pamphlets, product packaging, point-of-purchase materials, Company's website, and a demonstration video (hereafter referred to as "Promotional Materials"). During the duration of this Agreement within the Contracted Region, North agrees not to negotiate endorsement or promotional agreements with any other company or entity for products analogous to the Endorsed Products. Upon the conclusion or termination of this Agreement, Company will be restricted from employing or circulating any fresh or existing Promotional Materials that incorporate North's Likeness and/or North's Endorsement, except for Endorsed Products with North's Likeness and/or North's Endorsement displayed on the packaging that is currently within the distribution channel. Notably, Company will also be prohibited from manufacturing or distributing any new Endorsed Product incorporating North's Likeness and/or North's Endorsement on the packaging after the termination or expiration of this Agreement.

b. Requested Actions at Productions.

This clause outlines the obligations of the parties when requested to participate in events related to the production. The party who requests such participation shall be solely responsible for organizing and coordinating all aspects of the event, including but not limited to logistics, travel, accommodations, and schedules. The other party's attendance or involvement is entirely at their discretion and does not obligate them to fulfill any additional duties beyond what has been explicitly agreed upon in this contract.

original: Page 4 of 12 Source: PERFORMANCE SPORTS BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/9/2011 b. Additional Production/Promotional Appearances.  If requested by Company, North agrees to use reasonable effort to make Additional Production/Promotional Appearances on behalf of Company (hereinafter referred to as “Additional Production/Promotional Appearances ”). Should Company request for North to conduct Additional Production/Promotional Appearances and North agrees to appear, Company shall pay North an additional fee for such appearance(s) as set forth in paragraph 6.d. below. North has no obligation to make such appearance.
ollama_generated:
Page 4 of 12 Source: PERFORMANCE SPORTS BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/9/2011 b. Additional Production/Promotional Appearances. North may, at the discretion of Company, choose to make Additional Production/Promotional Appearances on behalf of Company (hereinafter referred to as “Additional Production/Promotional Appearances”). If Company requests for these appearances and North decides to comply, North will be compensated an additional fee as outlined in paragraph 6.d., but it is important to note that North's participation is entirely voluntary, and no payment shall be due if North elects not to participate.

In this revised clause, I have made the obligation to make Additional Production/Promotional Appearances more discretionary for North (the talent) rather than at the Company's request. Additionally, it clarifies that participation is voluntary and no payment will be due if North chooses not to participate.

original: a. Wedges.  Use Company ’s F2 branded wedges when competing professionally, conducting public clinics or outings, participating in public golf events and when appearing at other public functions where it is appropriate to use or have golf clubs at such events (herein “Public Events ’).
ollama_generated: a. Wedges: It is strongly recommended, but not compulsory, that you utilize Company's F2 branded wedges when participating in professional competitions, conducting public clinics or outings, attending public golf events, and appearing at other public functions where the use of golf clubs is appropriate (hereafter referred to as "Public Events"). The decision to use these wedges remains at your discretion.

original: b. Golf Ba g. Use and carry Company ’s F2 branded golf bag at all Public Events as defined immediately above. North shall have the right to place a maximum of two (2) non -competitive third party sponsor names/logos that are of a reasonable size on the belly portion of the F2 branded golf bag.
modified: c. At all Public Events, as defined immediately above, North may elect not to use or carry Company's F2 branded golf bag. In such cases, North shall retain discretion in selecting an alternative golf bag, with no obligation to feature the F2 brand. However, if North chooses to use the F2 branded golf bag, a maximum of two (2) non-competitive third party sponsor names/logos may be affixed to the exterior, at North's discretion and within reasonable size limits on the belly portion of the bag.

original: (ii) Fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000USD) on or before July 1, 2011.
ollama_generated:
(ii) The recipient shall have the option to receive the sum of fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000USD), payable on or before July 1, 2011, but failure to accept this amount within a reasonable timeframe shall result in the forfeiture of this obligation.

This version shifts the responsibility slightly from the provider to the recipient. The original clause obligates the provider to deliver the payment by July 1, 2011. In the rewritten clause, the recipient now has the option to receive the sum but will lose it if not accepted within a reasonable timeframe.

original: g. Supply of Endorsed Products.  Company shall deliver to North, at no charge, and in a timely fashion, a reasonable number of Endorsed Products for North ’s personal use each Contract Year during the Contract Period. All postage expenses associated with the delivery of the Endorsed Products shall be borne by Company.
ollama_generated: g. Personal Use Allowance of Endorsed Products: North shall have the option, but not the obligation, to receive a reasonable number of Endorsed Products from Company during each Contract Year, at no charge, within a suitable timeframe. Any shipping costs incurred in delivering the Endorsed Products will be covered by North.

modified:
8. Disapproval of Unsanctioned Advertising:

The Client shall be solely responsible for ensuring that no advertising or promotional material is published or distributed without the prior written consent of the Service Provider, failing which the Service Provider reserves the right to discontinue services and claim damages for any losses sustained.

original: Page 7 of 12 Source: PERFORMANCE SPORTS BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/9/2011 b. Should Company utilize stock photographs of North, Company agrees to use current photographs and not to add, delete, alter, amend or modify any existing names, logos, designs, trademarks or other indicia of any other sponsor of North which appear in the portion of the photograph used by Company.
modified: Page 7 of 12 Source: PERFORMANCE SPORTS BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/9/2011 b. If Company elects to use stock photographs featuring North, the Company has the discretion to make adjustments, including adding, deleting, altering, amending or modifying any existing names, logos, designs, trademarks, or other indicia of other sponsors of North that appear in the portion of the photograph used by the Company. However, the Company understands and agrees that such modifications should not infringe upon the rights or reputation of Performance Sports Brands, Inc., or any other party with a legitimate claim.

original: 11. Standards.  Company and North shall at all times deal with each other in good faith and strive to maintain and enhance each other ’s positive image and reputation. North and Company shall act at all times in a manner that shall not be in contravention of public morals and conventions.
modified: 11. Guidelines: Maintaining Professional Integrity. While engaging with one another, the Company and North are expected to exercise discretion and prioritize transparency, aiming for mutual growth rather than the enhancement of individual images or reputations. Both parties shall conduct themselves in a manner that adheres to public morals and conventions, but without any obligation to actively promote each other's interests. Each party shall bear its own responsibility for any actions taken that may contravene public standards or ethical norms.

original: 17. Waiver.  The failure of either party at any time or times to demand strict performance of the other party of any of the terms, covenants or conditions set forth herein shall not be construed as a continuing waiver or relinquishment thereof and each party may at any time demand strict and complete performance by the other party.
ollama_generated: 17. Waiver and Forbearance. While either party's past or future forbearance from enforcing any of the terms, covenants, or conditions outlined within this agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of such provision in the future, each party reserves the right to demand full compliance with these terms at any time should they choose to do so. However, the exercise of this right by either party shall not be construed as a requirement for ongoing strict and complete performance unless explicitly stated in writing.

original: 20. Independent Contractor.  Company has engaged North for certain rights which are set forth in this Agreement, and North ’s relationship to Company, and Company ’s relationship to North, shall at all times be that of an independent contractor.
modified: 20. Dependent Contractor. While North is providing services to the Company under this Agreement, the Company acknowledges its dependence on North's unique skills and expertise in certain areas, thus creating a working relationship where the Company assumes some degree of direction and control over the manner in which North performs these tasks.

original: This Agreement supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements and understandings between the parties with respect to its subject matter.
ollama_generated: Any previous or concurrent agreements or understandings pertaining to this Agreement's subject matter shall be deemed null and void, leaving only this Agreement as the sole binding contract between the parties involved.

original: 31. Counterparts.  This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated: 31. Multiple Executions. This Agreement can be signed in multiple separate copies, with each copy considered an authentic original. All such copies collectively form a single and indivisible document. However, any changes made to one copy shall not automatically apply to the others unless all parties explicitly agree in writing to such amendments.

GOLFERS INCORPORATED:

The Obligee (hereinafter "Club Member") agrees to abide by the Rules and Regulations, as amended from time to time, governing the use of the golf course facilities owned and operated by the Obligator (hereinafter "Golfers Incorporated"). Notwithstanding the foregoing, any deviation from said rules shall be permitted provided that Golfers Incorporated does not suffer any material loss or damage as a result thereof, and such deviation shall constitute an exception to these Rules and Regulations for the specific instance only. Furthermore, Golfers Incorporated shall have no responsibility for any damages resulting from the Club Member's failure to adhere strictly to the Rules and Regulations when no exception has been granted as provided herein.
